Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Pluxee is a global player in employee benefits and engagement that operates in 31 countries. Pluxee helps companies attract, engage, and retain talent thanks to a broad range of solutions across Meal & Food, Wellbeing, Lifestyle, Reward & Recognition, and Public Benefits.

Powered by leading technology and more than 5,000 engaged team members, Pluxee acts as a trusted partner within a highly interconnected B2B2C ecosystem made up of more than 500,000 clients, 36 million consumers and 1.7 million merchants.

Conducting its business as a trusted partner for more than 45 years, Pluxee is committed to creating a positive impact on all its stakeholders, from driving business to local communities, to supporting wellbeing at work for employees while protecting the planet.

üöÄ Your next challenge 

Pluxee Data organization has chosen a decentralized Data Hub (central) & Data Spoke (local) organization where the Spokes are data factory teams covering multiple countries' Data needs and supporting business teams by delivering operations reporting, the ad-hoc analysis supporting decision making and advanced insights aiming at predicting clients, merchants, or consumers behaviors.

To support this objective, your responsibilities will encompass:
Data Analysis and interpretation: collecting and analyzing data from various sources to identify trends and insights relevant for business improvement.
Visualization and reporting: developing clear and informative dashboards and reports using data visualization tools to effectively communicate findings to business teams.
Decision support: providing ad-hoc analyses and statistical modeling to assist business teams in making informed decisions and defining key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure progress.

üåü You‚Äôre a match

Technical Skills:
5 years of experience as Data Analyst with at least 3 years in a permanent full time Data Analyst role. 
Experience supporting business areas in E2E Data Analysis and Visualization process, from gathering stakeholder¬¥s requirements to data collection, cleaning, analysis, and dashboard, reporting, and KPIs design and delivery.
+3 years of work experience using SQL on daily basis.
+3 years of work experience with Data Visualization tools, with at least 2 years experience using Power BI and DAX with advanced proficiency and storytelling skills.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques, enabling advanced data analysis will be a plus Examples: Fraud detection, scoring, attrition.
Experience working with agile methodologies and tools such as Jira. 
Experience in finance or payment services companies will be a plus.
Excellent communication skills, oral and written, with the ability to interact with different types of stakeholders (technical, non-technical, C level).
Bilingual in French and Advanced level in English as will be working with Global teams.
Ability to work in a hybrid mode (3 days at the office and 2 days at home).

Soft Skills:
Effective communication: strong verbal and written communication skills in both French and English, adept at interacting with diverse stakeholders with varying cultural backgrounds and technical expertise.
Analytical thinking: highly analytical and detail-oriented, with a knack for problem-solving and extracting insights from complex datasets.
Proactive and motivated: proactive attitude, hands-on approach, and a high level of motivation to learn quickly and adapt to new challenges in an ever-moving domain.

üîé To get this challenge
Videocall with Talent Acquisition Expert.
Videocall with the Hiring Manager (Data Spoke Manager).
Technical interview.

üèÖ Your team
Reporting to Jean Francois Prince (Data Spoke Manager).

üìç Your Location
Central Paris, Paris.
Ability to work in a hybrid mode (3 days at the office and 2 days at home).

‚òÄÔ∏è Happy at work
A meaningful job: build the future of employee benefits and contribute to the quality of life at work for others, you will impact positively local communities too. It counts!
A great culture: we respect and care authentically about our people, we embrace work-life balance, new ideas and we have a lot of fun!
Employee experience is what we do. So, you can expect a comprehensive package including benefits and an annual bonus based on performance.

About Pluxee
Working at Pluxee is joining a multicultural team that moves as one. It‚Äôs also a place where your individual ideas, perspectives, and input count. You‚Äôll be given the freedom and autonomy you need to do impactful work, supported by a team that cares about your well-being, growth, and work/life balance.
It‚Äôs the agility you‚Äôd expect from a fast-growing small business, with the stability that only a globally renowned company with +45 years in the business can offer. Put a part of yourself into the future of employee benefits and meaningfully contribute to lives and communities worldwide."

Title:

Junior Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Intale is a VC backed retail-tech company that consists of gifted people that are not afraid to get their hands dirty.

Here we give superhero powers to small local retail stores, transforming them into a state-of-the-art, cutting-edge business. We have vowed to remove the slack and the fragmentation from offline retail. We achieve that through our platform that connects stores, distributors and retail manufacturers, creating a unique transparent marketplace.

Do you love helping businesses make data-driven decisions? Do you have a passion for analyzing data and finding trends?

Our team is expanding and we are looking to add a passionate Junior Data Analyst who who get his/her hands dirty with raw data, package it in meaningful ways and work with our key clients to deliver value adding actionable insights.

Your role will be to:

Develop a deep understanding our core data, structures and insight possibilities
Design categories and subcategories to slice and dice the data in meaningful ways
Ensure that the quality of the data is of the standards promised to our clients
Introduce the new products into our Universal Product database and set up the relevant processes and workflows
Extract the data and analyze it using a standard business intelligence tool


Requirements

You should have a genuine passion for data and data-driven decision making. Additionally:

Strong verbal and written communication skills (Greek/English)
Degree in statistics, math and/or computer science
Very good knowledge of MS SQL and/or MySQL
Very good knowledge of MS Excel
Experience in the use of business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau) will be considered a plus
Expertise in Retail and/or FMCG Industry will be considered a plus
Flexibility in approach and innovative thinker


Benefits

Our people mean the world to us, and we only recruit the best. For the talents in our business, we offer great benefits and opportunities to develop with us.

Competitive package
Private health insurance plan
Training and advancement opportunities

Think you fit the bill? Tick the boxes, we need to talk."

Title:
SQL Data Analyst
SQL Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
As an SQL Data Analyst/Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining SQL-based data solutions to support our business intelligence and data analytics initiatives. This role requires a strong understanding of SQL Server technologies, data integration tools, and reporting/analytics platforms.

The key elements resource should have:

 SQL Development: Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements.

 Data Integration: Utilize SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.

 Data Analysis: Develop and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting.

 Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.

 Data bricks: Leverage Data bricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with SQL-based solutions as needed.

 Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements.

 Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution.

 Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.

 Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions.


Technical Skills:

 SQL Server: Proficiency in SQL Server (2008 and above) including T-SQL, SSIS, and SSAS.

 Data Modeling: Experience with tabular models and multidimensional cube development in SSAS.

 Power BI: Expertise in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards.

 Data bricks: Familiarity with Data bricks for big data analytics and integration.

 Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.

 Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

 Project Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, delivering high-quality results within deadlines"

Title:
Junior Data Analyst
Junior Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
We‚Äôre looking for a talented Junior Data Analyst to help us change the world of digital advertising together!

WHO WE ARE
Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.
We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.

KEY FIGURES
2014 ¬∑ Founded by two ex-Googlers
2018 ¬∑ 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth
2021 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 40M‚Ç¨ & +11 countries & +260 Seedtaggers
2022 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 250M‚Ç¨ + expansion into the U.S market

YOUR CHALLENGE
You will propose new analysis to get the most out of our current data and define what additional data will be needed to improve our current Contextual Understanding
Your data visualization skills will be key to grasp the attention of the public and transmit complex information into simple explanations
You will get full ownership of our contextual data to offer insights and communication strategies to our most relevant clients
You will present your results internally and externally, co-creating contextual strategies with big clients (from Nissan to Coca-Cola, Heineken, Tag Heuer, etc.)
You will help us build contextual tools that would allow the democratization of data inside the company: from sales, to marketing, to operations, the different teams should be using contextual data in their day-to-day
Some experience building extract, transform, load (ETL) data pipelines will be needed here.
You will analyze performance of our current Contextual products and actively proposing improvements together with the Product Team
Finally, you will build a strong knowledge of the ecosystem and sector to develop a strong instinct of how to improve our products and positioning. Creativity here will also be a must!
During all these tasks, you will be using the latest technologies developed by our Machine Learning Engineers: amazing NLP and CV models to get the most out of massive amounts of data!

YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF
You have a relevant degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics or an analytics related field
You have between 1 and 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis or a related field
You are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a must
You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative, solutions
You have full proficiency in Spanish and English
You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment
You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills
You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment
You like to have fun while working and don‚Äôt take yourself too serious!

It would be a big plus if you
Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders

SEEDTAG PERKS
üöÄ Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities
üíØ One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you‚Äôre a top performer (think of Brazil, NY..., üèñÔ∏è)
‚åõ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life
üá¨üáß üá™üá∏ üá´üá∑ Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses
üìö Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)
üçª We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues! A Yearly offsite with all the company, team offsites, and Christmas events.
üèã Gympass

BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG
Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject ""that‚Äôs the way it‚Äôs always been done"". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.

Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!"

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Opportunity

ILIAS Solutions is on the hunt for an experienced Data Analyst, adept at leveraging ERP and sensor data from sophisticated military assets to bolster decision-making and operational efficiency across our defense clientele.

With a focus on delivering standardized analytical solutions, this role calls for an individual capable of swiftly grasping new subjects, informed by a broad dataset encompassing various defense assets and their supporting operations. Your analytical skills will illuminate strategic insights for assets like Fighter Aircraft, Military Transport Aircraft, Frigates, and Submarines, offering our clients a competitive edge in defense capabilities.

You can work in the Almere or Brussels office and at home, with occasional travel to global customer sites.

Want to learn more about your mission? Scroll down for more information.

Your mission

As Our Data Analyst You Will

Analyze a wide array of data sources, including ERP and sensor data from diverse military assets such as Fighter Aircraft, Military Transport Aircraft, Frigates, and Submarines, to provide uniform and powerful analytical solutions.
Ensure our data analysis services securely and effectively meet the common strategic objectives of our defense clients, applying a consistent approach across similar customer profiles.
Serve as the key communicator between technical teams and clients, adeptly translating complex data findings into actionable strategies.
Keep abreast of the latest developments in data analysis, enhancing our ability to provide cutting-edge analytical services.

Your capabilities

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Aviation, or a related field.
At least 3 years of experience in data analysis, with a proven ability to quickly adapt and understand new subjects based on a broad set of data.
Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, and statistical analysis, demonstrated through the application of these skills to diverse data sets.
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, capable of simplifying complex technical details for a non-technical audience.
Willingness to occasionally travel to engage directly with our international clients.

Land @ILIAS

Let Youness know what your talents are and send your CV to youness.kaissi@ilias-solutions.com

About Us

ILIAS Solutions is a company on a mission. With 150 passionate colleagues across Belgium, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the US, we design and deliver software solutions that make a real difference for our customers in Defense and other industries. As we continue to grow, we are looking for talented reinforcement who will make a difference every day."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
ComeOn Group in short
Founded in 2008, ComeOn Group is a leading global player in the rapidly growing iGaming market. Having launched its first online brand in 2010, ComeOn Group is running a wide range of exciting brands across multiple markets. Managing a multi-brand portfolio on its proprietary platform, offering a secure, innovative, and entertainment-driven player experience in both casino and sports. ComeOn Group is an international employer within the iGaming industry and has over 500 talented employees across 7 main locations.

Location: Malta + Hybrid 

We are on the lookout for a talented Data Analyst to join our dynamic team at ComeOn Group. In this role, you'll be at the heart of our data-driven decision-making process, transforming raw data into actionable insights that fuel business growth. As a Data Analyst, you'll extract, analyze and interpret complex data to provide clear, actionable insights. You'll collaborate with various teams, including Marketing, CRM, Compliance, and Payments, to support their data needs.

Responsibilities:
Design and develop complex SQL queries to extract and analyse large datasets.
Create data visualisations and reports using Tableau, to present findings to stakeholders.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in data to inform business decisions.
Provide ad hoc data analysis and reporting support to various stakeholders, including business leaders and product managers.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs).
Assist in data-driven decision-making by providing data insights and recommendations.

About you:
Strong proficiency in SQL, including advanced querying techniques and database design
Experience with data visualisation tools like Tableau, Power BI
Good level of MS Excel / Google Sheets
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
Ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a team
Strong attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines
Enthusiastic, positive and self-disciplined
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, adapt easily to changing situations and demonstrates flexibility in juggling priorities
At least 2 years of experience in data analysis
Experience with data analysis tools and technologies such as SQL, Tableau, Power BI
Knowledge of Python, and BigQuery would be considered a plus
Experience of working in igaming would also be a plus

So what can you expect from ComeOn as a place of work?

A competitive remuneration package including a company bonus scheme! üí∞
Fantastic quarterly team events and weekly company events üòé
A one-time bonus to help you set up a comfortable workstation at home (we‚Äôre truly Hybrid!)
On top of our Hybrid work arrangement, up to 40 days a year to work fully remote from anywhere üåé
Wellbeing allowance
A comprehensive, International Private Health Insurance
Breakfast at the office on Tuesdays
Lunch at the office on Mondays and Wednesdays

At ComeOn, we've embraced a Hybrid Work model, giving our employees the flexibility to work some days at home. Our offices are thoughtfully designed to support this model, featuring practical workspaces for focused efforts and collaborative zones for dynamic creative exchanges. We believe in the power of collaboration to drive innovation and success. While our offices are known for their vibrant atmosphere, rest assured that our primary focus is on achieving results together. We prioritize efficiency and maintain a balance between hard work and camaraderie. When you visit our offices, expect a warm welcome and professional support. Choose ComeOn for your next career move, and experience a workplace that values productivity, teamwork, and the spirit of collaboration.

At ComeOn Group we value diversity and we take concrete action to ensure fairness in our recruitment process. We are committed to assessing candidates on their merit without discriminating against any applicant for whatever reason that is protected by law. We truly value you, as you are.

Want to know more about us just visit our website www.comeon-group.com or any of our social media channels to take a deep dive into our culture!
LinkedIn
Instagram
Facebook
Glassdoor"

Title:
Data Analyst (6-months internship)
Data Analyst (6-months internship)
Job Description:
"About the job
Unlimitail is the Joint Venture between Carrefour Group and Publicis Group with the goal of becoming the leader of the retail media market in Europe and LATAM. By bringing together the power of Carrefour Links instore and e-commerce assets and traffic combined with Publicis Citrus Ad and Epsilon onsite and offsite retail media technologies, Unlimitail aims to become the leading retail media player in Continental Europe and South America for in-store and digital channels.

Missions:

As a Data Analyst Intern within the Product team, your mission will be to participate in the development of Unlimitail‚Äôs analytics capabilities. Your environment will be millions of transactional data coming from major retailers on the market to analyze and improve the performance of online and offline marketing campaigns.
As we work with both retailers (providing media inventory) and brands (buying media inventory), you will have the opportunity to gain a deep understanding of the retail media ecosystem.
You will work with different teams (Ad Operations, Marketing, Sales) in different countries and on a wide variety of topics.

Your missions will include:

Conducting end-to-end ad hoc analyses to help retailers maximize their inventory monetization
Participating in the development of new, cutting-edge capabilities to create the best
Conducting in-depth campaign analyses to support operational teams
Creating, updating, and maintaining reporting systems
Assisting team management in structuring our processes

At the end of this internship, you will have acquired:

Strong analytical and technical skills
Project management skills
In-depth knowledge of retail media and Adtech
Potentially your first job offer, as Unlimitail is in its early stages and keen to build a top team for the future

You‚Äôre the one we are looking for if:

You are studying at a top-tier business or engineering school
You have previous experience, preferably in a startup
You are proficient in querying databases using SQL (Python experience is a plus)
You have a first experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI
You have structured thinking and strong analytical abilities
You are fluent in both French and English

What we offer:

üöÄ An exceptional opportunity to be a part of an innovative and fulfilling adventure.
üó∫Ô∏è Work in a dynamic, international, and passionate environment
üë®‚Äçüíª Enjoy a flexible remote policy for a good work-life balance.
ü•ê Our offices are located in the heart of Paris (Ch√¢telet district).
üöÜ You'll receive a 90% reimbursement of ground transportation.
üçï We provide a 10‚Ç¨/day Swile card, and we'll cover 60% of the cost.

Process:

30-minute interview with a team member
45-minute interview with your future manager & the head of product (including some quick technical tests)

We are looking forward to working with the best and building an outstanding team for the future. Join us in this exciting journey!"

Title:
Data Analyst - Intern (Remote Internship - Data Analysis)
Data Analyst - Intern (Remote Internship - Data Analysis)
Job Description:
"About the job
Delve into the dynamic world of data analysis with an exclusive internship opportunity offered by Kreativstorm, a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and unlock your career aspirations in data analysis!

If you're passionate about data analysis and equipped with problem-solving skills, this internship is perfect for you. Under the guidance of industry experts, you'll tackle diverse data analysis projects, exploring concepts like data visualization, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and data mining. Gain hands-on experience in uncovering insights and informing decisions, all from the comfort of your home.

Internship Overview and Details:

Location: Fully Remote

Schedule: Part-Time Internship

Duration: 3 months with the possibility of permanent employment after the internship period

Requirements

Ideal Candidates:

Students pursuing a degree or recent graduates in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field. 
Aspiring data analysts keen on unraveling complex datasets and extracting meaningful insights. 
Analytical thinkers adept at translating data into actionable recommendations. 
Effective communicators who thrive in collaborative team settings. 
Detail-oriented individuals excelling in fast-paced, analytical environments. 
Enthusiastic learners committed to honing their skills in data analysis. 
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL) highly valued. 
Familiarity with statistical techniques, data visualization, and database management advantageous. 
Some initial industry experience is a big plus. 

Your Contribution:

Contribute to data collection, cleaning, and analysis processes. 
Collaborate with the data analysis team to develop analytical models and insights. 
Aid in interpreting data trends and patterns to inform strategic decision-making. 
Bring fresh perspectives and innovative solutions to tackle data challenges. 
Foster a collaborative team environment focused on excellence in data analysis. 
Assist in documenting and presenting analysis results and recommendations. 

Benefits

Why Join Us?

Kreativstorm is a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Our team of experienced consultants brings a diverse range of talents and backgrounds, allowing us to provide tailored solutions to businesses of all sizes and industries. As part of the Yes Network Group, LLC, a reputable US holding company, we have access to extensive resources and expertise. Join us and start your journey in data analysis today!

Apply now and pave the way for your future in data analysis!"

Title:
Junior Data Analyst
Junior Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Created over 30 years ago and based in more than 30 countries, ALTEN Group supports its customers‚Äô development strategies in the areas of innovation, R&D and technological information systems. ALTEN works with key actors in the Aeronautics & Space, Defense & Naval, Security, Automotive, Rail, Energy, Life Sciences, Finance, Retail, Telecommunications and Services sectors.
ALTEN Delivery Center Eastern Europe (ADC Eastern Europe) is part of ALTEN Group‚Äôs offshore delivery centers network, together with centers from other regions such as Morocco, India, Mexico, and Spain.
At the moment, ADC Eastern Europe has 400 employees, three sites (Iasi, Bucharest and Gliwice) and offers engineering and IT consulting services for international clients from the automotive, aero, energetic, finance or life sciences sectors. Our team focuses on cultivating a feeling of belonging to a technical environment based on creativity and constant innovation.

As a Junior Data Analyst you will:

Collaborate with team members to collect and analyze data

Provides resulting analyses to stakeholders

Open minded and solutions oriented
Very good analytical and problem-solving skills

A customer service mindset and focused on quality


Benefits

If it sounds like a great opportunity, look below to see what‚Äôs in it for you:

¬∑ Home/office working possibilities ‚Äì Enjoy flexible working hours and the ability to choose if you want to work from home or pop into the office, you are free to choose.
¬∑ Career Growth Opportunities - Immerse yourself in a world of exciting potential for advancing your career, where professional development and personal growth are nurtured within our organization.
¬∑ We do things better together ‚Äì teamwork, supportive people & positive dynamics.

¬∑ Cutting-Edge Technology - Work with state-of-the-art tools and technologies, allowing you to stay at the forefront of automotive software development.
¬∑ Continuous learning and opportunities - you‚Äôll be constantly exposed to new concepts, ideas and frameworks from your peers as you work on different projects challenging you to stay at the top of your game.

Title:
SQL Data Analyst/Developer
SQL Data Analyst/Developer
Job Description:
"About the job
The Key Elements Resource Should Have

 SQL Development: Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements. 
 Data Integration: Utilize SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading. 
 Data Analysis: Develop and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting. 
 Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making. 
 Databricks: Leverage Databricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with SQL-based solutions as needed. 
 Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements. 
 Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution. 
 Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs. 
 Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions. 

Technical Skills

 SQL Server: Proficiency in SQL Server (2008 and above) including T-SQL, SSIS, and SSAS. 
 Data Modeling: Experience with tabular models and multidimensional cube development in SSAS. 
 Power BI: Expertise in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards. 
 Databricks: Familiarity with Databricks for big data analytics and integration. 
 Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail. 
 Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. 
 Project Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, delivering high-quality results within deadlines 

Certifications Needed

 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus."

Title:
Supply Data Analyst - Internship
Supply Data Analyst - Internship with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Ogury is a global adtech company that delivers Personified Advertising solutions grounded in privacy to brands, agencies and publishers by focusing on targeting personas, not people.

We deliver relevant audiences at scale and on quality publisher inventory thanks to our exclusive data, which is meticulously collected and crafted from millions of self-declared customer surveys, enriched with billions of impactful data points, and refined by AI. This results in audience insights and performance not available through any other AdTech platform.

Founded in 2014, Ogury is a global organization with a diverse team of 500+ people across 17 countries.

At Ogury, our vision unites us all. But we know that it takes people from all walks of life to come together and make it happen. We embrace and celebrate what makes us different, creating a unique and winning culture where everyone feels safe, has access to the same opportunities, and is excited about bringing their most authentic self to work. Everyday.

Together we‚Äôre changing the face of adtech with values that inspire excellence, standards that encourage a leadership mindset, and an inclusive workplace where Ogurians are engaged and know they belong.

About The Role

Ogury is seeking a highly motivated Supply Data Analyst Intern to help our efforts towards data analysis. The intern will assist in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support our business decisions and strategic initiatives. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data analysis and work within a dynamic and innovative tech environment.

What You Will Do

Data Collection and Cleaning: Assist in gathering data from multiple sources, including internal databases, spreadsheets, and third-party data systems. Perform data cleaning and preprocessing to ensure data integrity and accuracy. Help maintain data quality and support data management activities.
Data Analysis: Conduct basic statistical analyses and generate reports to identify trends and patterns. Support senior analysts with more complex data analysis tasks. Utilize tools such as Excel, SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
Reporting and Visualization: Create data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using Metabase as the main tool. Present analytical findings to team members and stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Support and Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support. Assist in developing and implementing data collection systems and strategies to optimize data efficiency and quality.
Learning and Development: Stay current with industry trends, tools, and techniques in data analysis. Participate in training sessions and workshops to enhance analytical skills and knowledge.

About You

Currently pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Familiarity with Microsoft Excel; knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools such as Metabase is a plus.
Basic understanding of statistical methods and data analysis techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.Good communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with programming languages such as Python.
Understanding of data warehousing concepts and tools.
Experience with big data tools and technologies."

At eBay, we're more than a global ecommerce leader ‚Äî we‚Äôre changing the way the world shops and sells. Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
About us:

Amach is an industry-leading technology driven company with headquarters located in Dublin and remote teams in UK and Europe.

Our blended teams of local and nearshore talent are optimised to deliver high quality and collaborative solutions.

Established in 2013, we specialise in cloud migration and development, digital transformation including agile software development, DevOps, automation, data and machine learning‚Ä¶

We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst with a focus on operational research to join our customer's team. You will be working on scoping, shaping, and utilising statistical and algorithmic knowledge to drive data-driven decisions and strategies.

Key responsibilities & duties include:

Conduct thorough data analysis to support business decisions and operational improvements
Scope and shape complex data projects, ensuring alignment with business objectives and requirements
Apply statistical and algorithmic techniques to analyse data sets, identify trends, and provide actionable insights
Gather, combine, and manipulate data from multiple sources (databases, dashboards, 3rd parties, etc.)
Assess the value of data, considering potential use cases and quality issues
Understand business processes and decisions to align data analysis with business needs
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators and business metrics
Build models (spreadsheet, statistical, Python, etc.) to support one-off decisions or prototype models for production by data engineers and data scientists
Build dashboards in Tableau or Power BI as prototypes for productionisation
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver solutions that meet those needs
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing best practices for data management and validation
Build good relationships with the business to deliver useful insight and results in a collaborative way
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner

Required Skills:

Proven experience in operational research and advanced data analysis techniques
Proficiency in statistical software and programming languages such as Python, R, or similar
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and extract meaningful insights
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present data findings effectively
Ability to work collaboratively within a team and independently with minimal supervision

What's in it for you:

An opportunity to join a fast-growing company 
Options for career advancement 
Learning and development opportunities 
Flexible working environment
Competitive rates based on experience 

Not for you?

Check out all of our open positions in our careers page and follow us on LinkedIn for future opportunities.

P.S. Share this with friends and co-workers! Don't be afraid they'll steal it from you, if you're amazing and smart we'll find a role for you. We are growing fast and we are always looking for talented people.

At Amach, we strive to be an inclusive community of open-minded individuals with different backgrounds and we are committed to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of diversity, equity and inclusion. We strongly believe that a diversity of experience and background is essential to create a fulfilling environment and better solutions for our people and our customers. All Amach employees and contractors are expected to honour this policy and act to ensure that every individual is respected in the workplace.

Your personal data

Amach will process your personal information in accordance with the EU's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). We will comply with data protection law and principles, which means that your data will be:

Used lawfully, fairly and in a transparent way
Collected only for valid purposes and not used in any way that is incompatible with those purposes
Relevant to the purposes we have told you about and limited only to those purposes
Accurate and kept up to date
Kept only as long as necessary for the purposes we have told you about
Kept securely

If you would like to contact us about your data, please use the following address: info@amach.com"

Title:
Data analyst
Data analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this mission, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilities
Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.

What we look for
Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.

What we offer
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Our pay packages are designed to attract and retain top professionals. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ‚Ç¨52,246. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Commitment & contract
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.

Location
Milan (Italy) or fully remote.

Before you apply
Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We‚Äôre extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply.

The selection process
We welcome applications in English and Italian. If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply."

Title:
Internship Controlling and Data Analysis
Internship Controlling and Data Analysis with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Do you love analyzing data and want to use your data science and controlling know-how to put maintenance data and key financial figures into a value-enhancing context? Would you like to work in a dynamic environment at the interface between controlling, production and IT? Then you'll fit right in with us!

Tasks

For our company Lufthansa Technik AG in Hamburg, we are looking for you as an intern in the Performance Enabling Center & Business Analytics team:

With us, you are guaranteed not to be emptying paper buckets or making coffee, but will be fully involved in the daily business of controlling and business analytics right from the start
Take responsibility for small projects and demonstrate your analytical skills and independent way of working
Support the team in the daily routine and shine with innovative ideas to increase efficiency
Perform data analysis and support the automation of reports and processes
Expand internal knowledge management through documentation in the internal wiki
Organize workshops within the team or with the interfaces

Benefits

Jobticket / Subsidized public transport
Discounts / shopping
Flexible working hours
Canteen (subsidized by employer)
Employee events (summer festivals, participation in sports competitions etc)
Free parking
Fitness studio / sports facilities / company football etc.

Requirements

To complete an internship in our company, you must be at least in your third semester at the time of the internship.

Enrollment for the entire duration of the internship (current enrollment certificate and written proof of mandatory internship must be included with the application) or internship between the Bachelor's and Master's degree program (gap year)
Your strengths include communication skills, reliability, organizational talent and the ability to work in a team
A concentrated way of working with an eye for detail and optimization potential determine your daily work routine
Good IT skills, in particular an interest in getting to know BI tools such as Power BI and SAC, as well as Excel
You are characterized by an independent way of working with strong analytical thinking skills
Your conceptual and structured way of working rounds off your profile

Further information can also be found in our FAQs. 

Company

Lufthansa Technik is the world's leading provider of maintenance, repair, overhaul and modification services in the aviation industry. With more than 22.000 employees and over 30 international subsidiaries, the Lufthansa Technik Group offers around 800 customers around the world a complete range of aircraft technology services.

The fascination for flying is what connects us all. In front of the engine or behind the laptop, in logistics or on the smallest individual part. We make aviation safe, rethink it ‚Äì and still keep our feet on the ground. Because only when every move is perfect and we discover innovative possibilities even in the smallest detail, we are proud. We believe in the potential of the individual. And in the fact that this potential grows best in the community. Our diversity makes us strong and allows us to stand out together."

Title:
SQL Data Analyst
SQL Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Job Title: SQL Data Analyst/Developer
Years of experience needed ‚Äì 5+ Years 
Location: Barcelona, Spain.( Hybrid)
Type: Fulltime role

Job Description:
As an SQL Data Analyst/Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining SQL-based data solutions to support our business intelligence and data analytics initiatives. This role requires a strong understanding of SQL Server technologies, data integration tools, and reporting/analytics platforms.
 The key elements resource should have:
SQL Development: Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements.
Data Integration: Utilize SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.
Data Analysis: Develop and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting.
Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.
Databricks: Leverage Databricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with SQL-based solutions as needed.
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements.
Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution.
Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions.
 Technical Skills: 
SQL Server: Proficiency in SQL Server (2008 and above) including T-SQL, SSIS, and SSAS.
Data Modeling: Experience with tabular models and multidimensional cube development in SSAS.
Power BI: Expertise in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards.
Databricks: Familiarity with Databricks for big data analytics and integration.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Project Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, delivering high-quality results within deadlines
 Certifications Needed: 
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.
 "

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
We are looking for a Data Analyst for a multimedia conglomerate based in Hamburg.
This Data Analyst will be responsible for conducting data analysis, developing reports and dashboards, providing insights to support HR processes and initiatives. The analyst will ensure HR data is accurate, complete, consistent, and accessible across the organization. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and excellent data visualization capabilities. 

KEY DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES: 
Assist in shaping and executing the companies HR Data Strategy.
Extract, transform, and analyse data from HRIS (SAP SuccessFactors) and explore new data sources.
Conduct data collection exercises as needed (e.g., surveys).
Work with stakeholders to identify their HR data analysis needs.
Create and maintain HR reports and dashboards (SAP SuccessFactors, Power BI).
Identify and implement process improvements, data quality enhancements, and automation opportunities.
Collaborate with Technology teams.
Understand and communicate stakeholder requirements, insights, and recommendations clearly.
Support ongoing projects like ESG Reporting, HR Management Dashboard, and Activity Analysis.

REQUIREMENTS: 
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g., statistics, mathematics, computer science, 
economics).
3+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in an HR analytics function.
Excellent Excel and PowerPoint skills
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).
Ideally experience working with SQL and Python.
Previous experience with SAP SuccessFactors preferred."

Title:
DATA ANALYST - DATA ENGINEER INTERNSHIP
DATA ANALYST - DATA ENGINEER INTERNSHIP

Senior Data Analyst
Senior Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Are you our new colleague?
We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Data Analyst at Diemen HQ, Netherlands. Hybrid. Fulltime.

people at the heart of everything we do
Working at Randstad is unlike working at any organization. Because at Randstad we put people at the heart of everything we do. This goes for our clients, our talent, our employees, and society. We combine our passion for people with the power of today‚Äôs technologies. This helps us support people and organizations in realizing their true potential. Learn more about our mission, history and values on our website: www.randstad.com

how you will contribute
As a Senior Data Analyst at Randstad, you will leverage your excellent analytical skills and keen eye for detail to drive impactful data insights. In this role, you will go beyond the numbers to be the voice of data, effectively communicating with decision-makers, product owners, and team leaders.
You will thrive in our fast-paced corporate environment, adapting quickly to new challenges and finding pragmatic solutions. You will take ownership of your work, ensuring accuracy and consistency in all your analyses. Your ability to translate complex data into actionable insights will play a crucial role in guiding strategic decisions and driving the success of our initiatives.

what you will be doing
Within this role, via Randstad Market Insights (RMI), you will enable colleagues to make data driven decisions and conclusions by making data accessible and understandable. Behind the scenes you will set up and execute data analysis on a variety of internal and external data sources as well as build dashboards to generate actionable insights, keep track of the key data quality metrics and identify opportunities for improvement.

who will you work with
As part of the RMI team, you will collaborate closely with data engineers, data scientists, a product owner, a scrum master, and junior data analysts based in the Global Competency Center (GCC). Additionally, you will work alongside a senior data engineer, ensuring seamless integration and analysis of data across various projects.
In this guiding role, you will mentor and support junior data analysts, fostering their growth and development within the team. Your responsibilities will involve working with internal stakeholders to understand their data needs, translating these requirements into actionable insights, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality data solutions.

what you will bring
Your communication, visualization, and storytelling skills are well-developed, allowing you to effectively translate complex data into clear, compelling narratives for various audiences. With a track record in data analysis, preferably within a market intelligence or similar corporate environment, you excel in collaborative settings and are an excellent team player.
You possess fluency in data visualization and business intelligence (BI) tools enabling you to create insightful and impactful visual representations of data as well as proficiency in SQL. Additionally, you have hands-on experience with cloud platforms, particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP), enhancing your ability to manage and analyze data in modern, scalable environments.
Your demonstrated ability to lead projects and mentor junior team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement within the team.

what‚Äôs in it for you
We put people at the heart of everything we do. Our employment conditions reflect this;
Hybrid work (based twice a week in Diemen HQ) with sporadic travel requirements
Competitive salary
An additional flexible benefit budget
Attractive bonus scheme
Option to take part in Randstad's success through our employee Share Purchase Plan
Option to go on a sabbatical leave or buy extra holidays
Attractive mobility arrangements
Opportunity to give back to local communities through paid volunteering leave
Growth and development opportunities in a fast changing global environment
Working with great people and being part of a network where everyone wants you to succeed
An environment where differences are understood, valued and celebrated

We want our teams and talent to reflect the rich diversity of the societies we serve. We thrive for an environment of belonging, safety and confidence. So everyone can bring their whole selves to work and flourish. Learn more about equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging at randstad here.

If you recognize yourself in the profile above, we invite you to apply for this role. For more information you can reach out to our Internal Talent Acquisition Partner Jenny Roberts (jennifer.roberts@randstadsourceright.co.uk)

The recruitment procedure consists of a screening, a 30 minute online behavioural assesment and at least two interviews.

We are an inclusive employer and should you require any reasonable adjustments in order to complete any aspect of the recruitment process, please contact the Internal Talent Acquisition (ITA) team"

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
At Aluxion we are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst to join our team and play a pivotal role in driving data-driven decision making. The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for uncovering insights from data.


Responsibilities

.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field. 
5+ years of experience in data analysis and project management.
Strong SQL skills and proficiency in cloud data warehousing platforms.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with Python programming language.
Knowledge of marketing analytics and attribution modeling.

If you are a data-driven individual with a passion for uncovering insights and driving business growth, we encourage you to apply!"

Title:
Transportation Data Analyst (Citymapper)
Transportation Data Analyst (Citymapper) with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
At Citymapper (powered by Via), we‚Äôre on a mission to help make complex cities more accessible to everyday users. Our application transports millions of people in hundreds of cities around the world by giving them access to the most current and sophisticated transportation options available. We make getting around your favorite city easy, so that you can enjoy the ride.

As a Transportation Data Analyst  at Citymapper, you will be managing the data that is the backbone of our application‚Äôs success. Y our work directly impacts our user experience, and is the difference between a user seeing a bus drive away, or reaching it just in time. Millions of users around the world trust our application to be on time for work, a job interview, or a date - and we take great responsibility in fulfilling that need.

This job can be done remotely if you're based in England, the Netherlands, Germany or Bulgaria. If you prefer hybrid, we have offices in London, Berlin, Paris, Amsterdam, and Sofia.

What You'll Do:

 You will help to manage the timetable data that powers the Citymapper application. Using proprietary tools and methods, you will transform often messy transit schedules into shiny and reliable user information. 
 You will build, validate and ship data to production on a daily basis. 
 You will manage data in a range of cities and across different formats. 
 You will work with our engineers to build for scale by improving tools and automating tasks. 
 You will ensure data quality in our web and mobile products so that users continue to love and trust Citymapper. 

Who You Are:

 You have a passion for public transportation and cities, and an interest in how public transportation networks operate. 
 You are comfortable dealing with large data sets, and have an eagerness to learn new data skills. 
 You take a hands-on, practical, pragmatic attitude to your work. 
 You have exceptional attention to detail, and an ability to communicate those details to other collaborators. 
 You have up to 3 years of experience working with data, Python and/or common transit data formats (GTFS, TransXChange, Siri, Hafas, etc). 

Compensation and Benefits:

Becoming part of Via, a company that was awarded for its commitment to social good
Joining the team working on the industry-leading mobile app that is loved and trusted by millions of users
State of the art hardware for you to perform your work worry free
Ongoing support and training to ensure you have the resources you need to thrive and progress in your career
A hybrid or remote work model. Remote work is possible if you're based in one of these countries: England, Germany or Netherlands
Competitive compensation
Monthly health stipend 
25 vacation days

We‚Äôre Via, and we build technology that changes the way the world moves. We pioneered the TransitTech category to ensure that the future of transportation is shared, dynamic public mobility ‚Äî the kind that reduces carbon emissions across congested cities, minimizes reliance on private cars, and provides everyone with accessible, efficient, and affordable ways of getting around.

We created the first end-to-end TransitTech solution for cities and transit agencies, offering world-class software, service design, and operational expertise to fundamentally improve the way the world moves.

Via was founded with the guiding principle that we go further when we go together. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. All backgrounds, identities, and voices are welcomed and celebrated at Via.

Ready to join the ride?

Via is an equal opportunity employer."

"About the job
D√©tail de l'offre

Description De La Mission

Bouygues Energies and Services is a small branch within the Equans France and we specialize in energy and, more broadly, in electrical engineering for renewable energies. Our job is to design, build and maintain photovoltaic power plants such as shading systems and solar power plants, which can be on land or floating.

Equans France, in general, designs, installs, maintains, and operates technical systems and customized services in over 30 countries. These services enable customers to combine control over their energy consumption with quality of life and working conditions for their users.

Among the 27 000+ employees that are accompanying Equans France on its adventure, 550 of them is supporting the Energy Business of Bouygues Energies & Services.

New job opportunity : Equans Solar & Storage is hiring :

?? The PV Performance Data Analyst is a member of BYES International O&M team managing ca.1GWp of utility scale solar PV power plants. ??

? He/she will be an integral person in the day-to-day operation of solar farms, including assessing the performance of the solar farms, analysing operation data with a view to extract actionable insights, real-time monitoring when required and troubleshooting technical issues with the generating assets when required. ?

 Main Duties & Responsibilities:

1 Remote monitoring of global solar O&M portfolio with a focus on data analytics.

2 Collection, triage and analysis of data from sites as well as maintenance operations (may occasionally require liaison with on-the-ground teams and/or O&M managers).

3 Coordinates the onboarding of newly connected plants to our hypervisor in the agreed timeline.

4 Fault analysis and categorisation of failure modes, statistical analysis.

5 Availability and Performance Ratio calculations, eventually developing a standardised calculation method/format to benchmark all sites with the same calculations following best practice guidance.

6 Comparison of actual performance data with forecasts (Availability, Performance Ratio, Yield).

7 Development of in-house tools for data analytics that can be used across a diverse portfolio of assets.

8 To be an ""embassador"" of performance team across the PV wider team.

9 To keep abreast of technological and commercial market developments and to inform senior management of any salient information.

 Person Specification:

1 Degree in Engineering or Physics.

2 Good English level.

3 Knowledge of Microsoft Excel (Power BI optional).

4 Organisational skills, reporting skills, attention to detail and good communication.

5 0-3 years' experience in PV and/or SCADA and/or Data Analyst: Knowledge in HV electrical, SCADA systems and photovoltaics is a bonus, but a self-learning, problem-solving personality is a must.

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
We're Creative Fabrica, a fast-scaling tech start-up from Amsterdam.

Our mission

Enable creativity by giving access to everything related to the creative process: inspiration, learning, creating, and sharing. The ‚ÄòCreative Inspiration Flywheel‚Äô

This creates a self-sustaining community that lives within the Creative Fabrica ecosystem.

About the platform

We launched in 2016 as a marketplace for fonts with a subscription service. In the last 8 years, we have been through tremendous growth, and we're just getting started!

We have scaled to 40 million+ monthly page views, over 20 million listed products, and 20000+ active designers.

Our focus is to create a platform for designers to offer exceptional high-quality content. We make their products searchable in unique ways. This allows our customers to speed up their workflow, allowing them to focus on what they love most: Creating.

Creative Fabrica is on the lookout for a dynamic, inquisitive, and driven Data Analyst who is eager to dive into the depths of data, uncover hidden insights, and contribute to our ambitious growth plans. Suppose you are passionate about turning data into compelling stories and making a tangible impact on business decisions. In that case, this is your opportunity to join an international team and shape the future of data analytics at Creative Fabrica.

In this role, you will be a key player in deciphering complex data, acting as a 'data detective' to uncover critical insights from vast data sets. You will be instrumental in enhancing our understanding of customers, improving our predictive capabilities, and driving growth.

What you will do:

Collect, manage, and maintain data sources, including internal databases and external datasets, to ensure data accuracy and currency.
Perform complex data analyses using statistical methods, machine learning algorithms, and data visualization tools to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Identify business challenges and develop analytical solutions to address these challenges and support decision-making.
Clearly and concisely communicate the results of analyses to stakeholders through reports, dashboards, and presentations.
Translate data findings into actionable recommendations for improving processes, products, or strategies.
Collaborate with teams within the organization, including IT, marketing, and operational departments, to understand data analysis needs and provide appropriate solutions.
Stay up-to-date with new technologies and methodologies in the field of data analysis and apply them to enhance analysis processes.

What you will bring: 

Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field, such as statistics, computer science, mathematics, or a related field.
At least 2 years of industry experience.
Strong programming skills in SQL.
Experience with data visualization and data analysis tools.
Knowledge of statistical and machine learning techniques.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

Nice to have:

Experience in complex modeling.
Strong programming skills, preferably in languages like Python, R, and/or other relevant tools.
Experience and/or understanding of DBT (Data Build Tool).

Let us take care of you.

Competitive Compensation: We believe that hard work, skills, and ambition should be fairly compensated.
Top-Notch Tools and Gear: You'll be equipped with everything you need: a top-of-the-line laptop, the latest collaboration tools, and stylish accessories to match.
Awesome Office: Based in a beautiful office in the center, working here means delicious lunches cooked by our very own chefs, plus access to our own CF library to keep the learning going.
And a great team: We work hard and have fun together. On Fridays, we kick off the weekend together at the local bar, but there's more; we regularly organize events and company trips, creating opportunities to bond and build meaningful connections.

Is this you?

Get in touch! We'd love to speak to you.

You can apply by clicking the ""Apply now"" button.

Creative Fabrica is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees."

Title:
Portfolio Data Analyst
Portfolio Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
We offer:

‚Ä¢ Unique opportunity to get exposure to the global lending and capital markets business while working with colleagues in London
‚Ä¢ Technical language, proprietary environment, and infrastructure training
‚Ä¢ Technical and professional on-the job training in securitized products and structured credit
‚Ä¢ An introduction to Morgan Stanley and the global financial markets
‚Ä¢ Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley
‚Ä¢ Contract via 3rd party agency

You will:

‚Ä¢ Analyze assets including commercial real estate loans, residential mortgages, auto loans and other cash-flow generating assets
‚Ä¢ Provide oversight of ongoing client requests for fundings
‚Ä¢ Work with other internal teams to build-out transaction & collateral monitoring systems
‚Ä¢ Provide senior management with monthly, quarterly and annual updates on the lending portfolio
‚Ä¢ Conduct market and asset level research

You have:

‚Ä¢ BSc or MSc in finance or a quantitative field (e.g. finance, economics and engineering)
‚Ä¢ 0-3 years of experience. Preferably a background with a financial institution, rating agency or accounting firm
‚Ä¢ Excellent data management skills: MS Excel, pivot tables, database management (Access or SQL experience is a plus)
‚Ä¢ Strong work ethic, attention to detail, analytical mindset
‚Ä¢ Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English

Team profile:

Morgan Stanley FID Deleverage and Lending group (‚ÄúDLG‚Äù) is seeking to hire an analyst to be part of its lending portfolio management platform based in Budapest.
DLG provides asset-backed financing solutions to institutional clients and manages a portfolio backed by a diverse range of assets including consumer loans, residential and commercial mortgages, corporate loans, etc. The asset management team within DLG provides ongoing portfolio management, monitoring and risk oversight, and reports to senior management.

About Morgan Stanley

Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. Throughout your contingent/leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley, you will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality. Our state-of-the-art offices in the City Centre have been designed to maximize collaboration.
At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modelling, Finance, Risk Management, Operations and Data & Analytics from our new state-of-the-art offices near the Danube and our City Gate office in the heart of the city center."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Who We Are

üåç Ready to join the ultimate decision-making dream team? Hop aboard the Rocketship!

At Finder, we're not just about helping people save money, make money, and snag sweet rewards; we're also on a mission to inject some excitement into the daily grind.

With offices in Sydney, Toronto, New York, London, and Wroclaw, we've built a dynamic community of over 290 curious minds. But we're not your typical corporate clan. Diverse thinkers united by our core purpose to make money easy, we have a shared passion for turning the norm on its head.

If you're itching to shake things up, develop your expertise, and be part of a crew that values creativity, drive, and a good dose of quirkiness, then you might just be the missing piece to our puzzle. So why wait? Join us and let's navigate this wild world of decisions together! üöÄüåü

Role Overview

The role‚Äôs purpose is to supercharge Finder‚Äôs data capabilities through the design, deployment and improvement of data analytics capabilities.

We are looking for a Data Analyst who will support our product teams with insights gained from analysing company data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimisation and to test the effectiveness of different courses of action.

They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-derived insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst at Finder, you will partner with stakeholders to build scalable infrastructure and a central hub of datasets and dashboards for the comparison business. This will support data-driven decisions and insights that translate directly to accelerate business growth and product improvement.

Work closely with the product, engineering, client services and publishing teams to support their decision making process with facts, insights and recommendations
Gather the requirements and determine the best course of action for analysis
Define a robust set of datasets and dashboards to support key business processes, e.g., forecasting, quarterly business planning etc.
Use the data to identify insights to inform hypotheses and test ideas.
Plan, and prioritise insights that drive Finder targets and ROI.
Analyse and evaluate A/B tests, report on results and recommend next steps
Build and maintain self-serve dashboards for internal and external stakeholders.
Train crew with dashboards / self serve analytics when needed.
Support company growth by discovering, analysing and communicating the critical user behavioural data

Desired Experience And Skills

Experience working with large-scale data sets
Experience of data analysis, cleaning or visualisation (for example using SQL, Python, spreadsheets or other technologies)
Experience in data modelling
Experience with Enterprise Digital Analytics such as Snowplow, GA360
Experience with modern data warehousing solutions (we use BigQuery)
Admirable team player qualities, including being collaborative, respectful, and service focused
A willingness to learn and apply various data analytics methodologies
A genuine passion for data and drive to communicate using data
Demonstrated analytical problem-solving skills and expertise
Demonstrated ability to pull apart complex data and communicate it to a non-technical audience

Preferred

Familiarity with dbt
Familiarity with GitHub
Deep understanding of building and maintaining data pipelines and assets, through robust change control.
Ability to work in an unstructured environment, navigate ambiguity, and bring clarity and structure as you go.
Ability to create and foster strong cross-functional networks and manage without authority.
Excellent presentation and communication skills.

Perks/Benefits

Vibrant office in the city center with a kitchen filled with snacks
Participation in our Finder Equity Plan (share options)
Organizational culture based on our core values
Multisport card
Access to training, development, and an extensive resource library
Private medical care
Lunch card
Hackofriday
Flexibility in when and where you can work with our hybrid policy, including opportunities to work abroad

Application Process

If this sounds like the kind of opportunity you've been looking for, select the 'Apply Now' button below to submit your cover letter and resume. Use your cover letter to introduce us to you; we want to know who you are, what you've worked on and why you think you'd be a great addition to the Finder team.

Inclusion

To build technology and products that are used and loved by people and solve real-world problems, we need to build a team with many different perspectives and experiences. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. 

We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible. Email talent@finder.com with any questions or feedback."

Title:
Data Analyst
