Title:
SQL Data Analyst
SQL Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Job Title: SQL Data Analyst/Developer
Years of experience needed ‚Äì 5+ Years 
Location: Barcelona, Spain.( Hybrid)
Type: Fulltime role

Job Description:
As an SQL Data Analyst/Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining SQL-based data solutions to support our business intelligence and data analytics initiatives. This role requires a strong understanding of SQL Server technologies, data integration tools, and reporting/analytics platforms.
 The key elements resource should have:
SQL Development: Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements.
Data Integration: Utilize SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.
Data Analysis: Develop and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting.
Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.
Databricks: Leverage Databricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with SQL-based solutions as needed.
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements.
Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution.
Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions.
 Technical Skills: 
SQL Server: Proficiency in SQL Server (2008 and above) including T-SQL, SSIS, and SSAS.
Data Modeling: Experience with tabular models and multidimensional cube development in SSAS.
Power BI: Expertise in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards.
Databricks: Familiarity with Databricks for big data analytics and integration.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Project Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, delivering high-quality results within deadlines
 Certifications Needed: 
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.
 "

Title:

Job Description:
"About the job

KEY DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:

Conduct data collection exercises as needed (e.g., surveys).
Work with stakeholders to identify their HR data analysis needs.
Create and maintain HR reports and dashboards (SAP SuccessFactors, Power BI).
Identify and implement process improvements, data quality enhancements, and automation opportunities.
Collaborate with Technology teams.
Understand and communicate stakeholder requirements, insights, and recommendations clearly.
Support ongoing projects like ESG Reporting, HR Management Dashboard, and Activity Analysis.

REQUIREMENTS: 
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g., statistics, mathematics, computer science, 
economics).
3+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in an HR analytics function.
Excellent Excel and PowerPoint skills
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).
Ideally experience working with SQL and Python.
Previous experience with SAP SuccessFactors preferred."

Title:
DATA ANALYST - DATA ENGINEER INTERNSHIP
DATA ANALYST - DATA ENGINEER INTERNSHIP

Senior Data Analyst
Senior Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Are you our new colleague?
We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Data Analyst at Diemen HQ, Netherlands. Hybrid. Fulltime.

people at the heart of everything we do
Working at Randstad is unlike working at any organization. Because at Randstad we put people at the heart of everything we do. This goes for our clients, our talent, our employees, and society. We combine our passion for people with the power of today‚Äôs technologies. This helps us support people and organizations in realizing their true potential. Learn more about our mission, history and values on our website: www.randstad.com

how you will contribute
As a Senior Data Analyst at Randstad, you will leverage your excellent analytical skills and keen eye for detail to drive impactful data insights. In this role, you will go beyond the numbers to be the voice of data, effectively communicating with decision-makers, product owners, and team leaders.
You will thrive in our fast-paced corporate environment, adapting quickly to new challenges and finding pragmatic solutions. You will take ownership of your work, ensuring accuracy and consistency in all your analyses. Your ability to translate complex data into actionable insights will play a crucial role in guiding strategic decisions and driving the success of our initiatives.

what you will be doing
Within this role, via Randstad Market Insights (RMI), you will enable colleagues to make data driven decisions and conclusions by making data accessible and understandable. Behind the scenes you will set up and execute data analysis on a variety of internal and external data sources as well as build dashboards to generate actionable insights, keep track of the key data quality metrics and identify opportunities for improvement.

who will you work with
As part of the RMI team, you will collaborate closely with data engineers, data scientists, a product owner, a scrum master, and junior data analysts based in the Global Competency Center (GCC). Additionally, you will work alongside a senior data engineer, ensuring seamless integration and analysis of data across various projects.
In this guiding role, you will mentor and support junior data analysts, fostering their growth and development within the team. Your responsibilities will involve working with internal stakeholders to understand their data needs, translating these requirements into actionable insights, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality data solutions.

what you will bring
Your communication, visualization, and storytelling skills are well-developed, allowing you to effectively translate complex data into clear, compelling narratives for various audiences. With a track record in data analysis, preferably within a market intelligence or similar corporate environment, you excel in collaborative settings and are an excellent team player.
You possess fluency in data visualization and business intelligence (BI) tools enabling you to create insightful and impactful visual representations of data as well as proficiency in SQL. Additionally, you have hands-on experience with cloud platforms, particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP), enhancing your ability to manage and analyze data in modern, scalable environments.
Your demonstrated ability to lead projects and mentor junior team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement within the team.

what‚Äôs in it for you
We put people at the heart of everything we do. Our employment conditions reflect this;
Hybrid work (based twice a week in Diemen HQ) with sporadic travel requirements
Competitive salary
An additional flexible benefit budget
Attractive bonus scheme
Option to take part in Randstad's success through our employee Share Purchase Plan
Option to go on a sabbatical leave or buy extra holidays
Attractive mobility arrangements
Opportunity to give back to local communities through paid volunteering leave
Growth and development opportunities in a fast changing global environment
Working with great people and being part of a network where everyone wants you to succeed
An environment where differences are understood, valued and celebrated

We want our teams and talent to reflect the rich diversity of the societies we serve. We thrive for an environment of belonging, safety and confidence. So everyone can bring their whole selves to work and flourish. Learn more about equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging at randstad here.

If you recognize yourself in the profile above, we invite you to apply for this role. For more information you can reach out to our Internal Talent Acquisition Partner Jenny Roberts (jennifer.roberts@randstadsourceright.co.uk)

The recruitment procedure consists of a screening, a 30 minute online behavioural assesment and at least two interviews.

We are an inclusive employer and should you require any reasonable adjustments in order to complete any aspect of the recruitment process, please contact the Internal Talent Acquisition (ITA) team"

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
At Aluxion we are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst to join our team and play a pivotal role in driving data-driven decision making. The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for uncovering insights from data.


Responsibilities
Project Management: Lead project planning, scheduling, and execution to ensure timely and high-quality delivery
Data Analysis and Modeling: Develop and maintain data models, write efficient SQL queries, and design and maintain cloud data warehouses
Stakeholder Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, providing regular updates and addressing their needs
Business Development: Contribute to business development initiatives by providing data-driven insights and recommendations
Data Governance: Create and maintain data dictionaries, lineage documents, and ERD diagrams to ensure data quality and consistency
Performance Analysis: Track and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) such as CPA, CLV, ROAS, conversion rates, and customer segmentation
A/B Testing: Conduct A/B tests to optimize marketing campaigns and improve performance
Data Visualization: Create compelling data visualizations using tools like Tableau, PowerBI, or Looker to communicate insights effectively

.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field. 
5+ years of experience in data analysis and project management.
Strong SQL skills and proficiency in cloud data warehousing platforms. 
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Looker).
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with Python programming language.
Knowledge of marketing analytics and attribution modeling.

If you are a data-driven individual with a passion for uncovering insights and driving business growth, we encourage you to apply!"

Title:
Transportation Data Analyst (Citymapper)
Transportation Data Analyst (Citymapper) with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
At Citymapper (powered by Via), we‚Äôre on a mission to help make complex cities more accessible to everyday users. Our application transports millions of people in hundreds of cities around the world by giving them access to the most current and sophisticated transportation options available. We make getting around your favorite city easy, so that you can enjoy the ride.

As a Transportation Data Analyst  at Citymapper, you will be managing the data that is the backbone of our application‚Äôs success. Y our work directly impacts our user experience, and is the difference between a user seeing a bus drive away, or reaching it just in time. Millions of users around the world trust our application to be on time for work, a job interview, or a date - and we take great responsibility in fulfilling that need.

This job can be done remotely if you're based in England, the Netherlands, Germany or Bulgaria. If you prefer hybrid, we have offices in London, Berlin, Paris, Amsterdam, and Sofia.

What You'll Do:

 You will help to manage the timetable data that powers the Citymapper application. Using proprietary tools and methods, you will transform often messy transit schedules into shiny and reliable user information. 
 You will build, validate and ship data to production on a daily basis. 
 You will manage data in a range of cities and across different formats. 
 You will work with our engineers to build for scale by improving tools and automating tasks. 
 You will ensure data quality in our web and mobile products so that users continue to love and trust Citymapper. 

Who You Are:

 You have a passion for public transportation and cities, and an interest in how public transportation networks operate. 
 You are comfortable dealing with large data sets, and have an eagerness to learn new data skills. 
 You take a hands-on, practical, pragmatic attitude to your work. 
 You have exceptional attention to detail, and an ability to communicate those details to other collaborators. 
 You have up to 3 years of experience working with data, Python and/or common transit data formats (GTFS, TransXChange, Siri, Hafas, etc). 

Compensation and Benefits:

Becoming part of Via, a company that was awarded for its commitment to social good
Joining the team working on the industry-leading mobile app that is loved and trusted by millions of users
State of the art hardware for you to perform your work worry free
Ongoing support and training to ensure you have the resources you need to thrive and progress in your career
A hybrid or remote work model. Remote work is possible if you're based in one of these countries: England, Germany or Netherlands
Competitive compensation
Monthly health stipend 
25 vacation days

We‚Äôre Via, and we build technology that changes the way the world moves. We pioneered the TransitTech category to ensure that the future of transportation is shared, dynamic public mobility ‚Äî the kind that reduces carbon emissions across congested cities, minimizes reliance on private cars, and provides everyone with accessible, efficient, and affordable ways of getting around.

We created the first end-to-end TransitTech solution for cities and transit agencies, offering world-class software, service design, and operational expertise to fundamentally improve the way the world moves.

Via was founded with the guiding principle that we go further when we go together. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. All backgrounds, identities, and voices are welcomed and celebrated at Via.

Ready to join the ride?

Via is an equal opportunity employer."

Du erweiterst das bestehende Berichtswesen und baust neue Dashboards innerhalb unseres Analyse- und Visualisierungstools Tableau auf.

Description De La Mission

Bouygues Energies and Services is a small branch within the Equans France and we specialize in energy and, more broadly, in electrical engineering for renewable energies. Our job is to design, build and maintain photovoltaic power plants such as shading systems and solar power plants, which can be on land or floating.

Equans France, in general, designs, installs, maintains, and operates technical systems and customized services in over 30 countries. These services enable customers to combine control over their energy consumption with quality of life and working conditions for their users.

Among the 27 000+ employees that are accompanying Equans France on its adventure, 550 of them is supporting the Energy Business of Bouygues Energies & Services.

New job opportunity : Equans Solar & Storage is hiring :

?? The PV Performance Data Analyst is a member of BYES International O&M team managing ca.1GWp of utility scale solar PV power plants. ??

? He/she will be an integral person in the day-to-day operation of solar farms, including assessing the performance of the solar farms, analysing operation data with a view to extract actionable insights, real-time monitoring when required and troubleshooting technical issues with the generating assets when required. ?

 Main Duties & Responsibilities:

1 Remote monitoring of global solar O&M portfolio with a focus on data analytics.

2 Collection, triage and analysis of data from sites as well as maintenance operations (may occasionally require liaison with on-the-ground teams and/or O&M managers).

3 Coordinates the onboarding of newly connected plants to our hypervisor in the agreed timeline.

4 Fault analysis and categorisation of failure modes, statistical analysis.

5 Availability and Performance Ratio calculations, eventually developing a standardised calculation method/format to benchmark all sites with the same calculations following best practice guidance.

6 Comparison of actual performance data with forecasts (Availability, Performance Ratio, Yield).

7 Development of in-house tools for data analytics that can be used across a diverse portfolio of assets.

8 To be an ""embassador"" of performance team across the PV wider team.

9 To keep abreast of technological and commercial market developments and to inform senior management of any salient information.

 Person Specification:

1 Degree in Engineering or Physics.

2 Good English level.

3 Knowledge of Microsoft Excel (Power BI optional).

4 Organisational skills, reporting skills, attention to detail and good communication.

5 0-3 years' experience in PV and/or SCADA and/or Data Analyst: Knowledge in HV electrical, SCADA systems and photovoltaics is a bonus, but a self-learning, problem-solving personality is a must.

6 Familiarity with databases and big data management are welcomed. ???

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
We're Creative Fabrica, a fast-scaling tech start-up from Amsterdam.

Our mission

Enable creativity by giving access to everything related to the creative process: inspiration, learning, creating, and sharing. The ‚ÄòCreative Inspiration Flywheel‚Äô

This creates a self-sustaining community that lives within the Creative Fabrica ecosystem.

About the platform

We launched in 2016 as a marketplace for fonts with a subscription service. In the last 8 years, we have been through tremendous growth, and we're just getting started!

We have scaled to 40 million+ monthly page views, over 20 million listed products, and 20000+ active designers.

Our focus is to create a platform for designers to offer exceptional high-quality content. We make their products searchable in unique ways. This allows our customers to speed up their workflow, allowing them to focus on what they love most: Creating.

Creative Fabrica is on the lookout for a dynamic, inquisitive, and driven Data Analyst who is eager to dive into the depths of data, uncover hidden insights, and contribute to our ambitious growth plans. Suppose you are passionate about turning data into compelling stories and making a tangible impact on business decisions. In that case, this is your opportunity to join an international team and shape the future of data analytics at Creative Fabrica.

In this role, you will be a key player in deciphering complex data, acting as a 'data detective' to uncover critical insights from vast data sets. You will be instrumental in enhancing our understanding of customers, improving our predictive capabilities, and driving growth.

What you will do:

Collect, manage, and maintain data sources, including internal databases and external datasets, to ensure data accuracy and currency.
Perform complex data analyses using statistical methods, machine learning algorithms, and data visualization tools to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Identify business challenges and develop analytical solutions to address these challenges and support decision-making.
Clearly and concisely communicate the results of analyses to stakeholders through reports, dashboards, and presentations.
Translate data findings into actionable recommendations for improving processes, products, or strategies.
Collaborate with teams within the organization, including IT, marketing, and operational departments, to understand data analysis needs and provide appropriate solutions.
Stay up-to-date with new technologies and methodologies in the field of data analysis and apply them to enhance analysis processes.

What you will bring: 

Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field, such as statistics, computer science, mathematics, or a related field.
At least 2 years of industry experience.
Strong programming skills in SQL.
Experience with data visualization and data analysis tools.
Knowledge of statistical and machine learning techniques.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

Nice to have:

Experience in complex modeling.
Strong programming skills, preferably in languages like Python, R, and/or other relevant tools.
Experience and/or understanding of DBT (Data Build Tool).

Let us take care of you.

Competitive Compensation: We believe that hard work, skills, and ambition should be fairly compensated.
Top-Notch Tools and Gear: You'll be equipped with everything you need: a top-of-the-line laptop, the latest collaboration tools, and stylish accessories to match.
Awesome Office: Based in a beautiful office in the center, working here means delicious lunches cooked by our very own chefs, plus access to our own CF library to keep the learning going.
And a great team: We work hard and have fun together. On Fridays, we kick off the weekend together at the local bar, but there's more; we regularly organize events and company trips, creating opportunities to bond and build meaningful connections.

Is this you?

Get in touch! We'd love to speak to you.

You can apply by clicking the ""Apply now"" button.

Creative Fabrica is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees."

Title:
Portfolio Data Analyst
Portfolio Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
We offer:

‚Ä¢ Unique opportunity to get exposure to the global lending and capital markets business while working with colleagues in London
‚Ä¢ Technical language, proprietary environment, and infrastructure training
‚Ä¢ Technical and professional on-the job training in securitized products and structured credit
‚Ä¢ An introduction to Morgan Stanley and the global financial markets
‚Ä¢ Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley
‚Ä¢ Contract via 3rd party agency

You will:

‚Ä¢ Analyze assets including commercial real estate loans, residential mortgages, auto loans and other cash-flow generating assets
‚Ä¢ Provide oversight of ongoing client requests for fundings
‚Ä¢ Work with other internal teams to build-out transaction & collateral monitoring systems
‚Ä¢ Provide senior management with monthly, quarterly and annual updates on the lending portfolio
‚Ä¢ Conduct market and asset level research

You have:

‚Ä¢ BSc or MSc in finance or a quantitative field (e.g. finance, economics and engineering)
‚Ä¢ 0-3 years of experience. Preferably a background with a financial institution, rating agency or accounting firm
‚Ä¢ Excellent data management skills: MS Excel, pivot tables, database management (Access or SQL experience is a plus)
‚Ä¢ Strong work ethic, attention to detail, analytical mindset
‚Ä¢ Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English

Team profile:

Morgan Stanley FID Deleverage and Lending group (‚ÄúDLG‚Äù) is seeking to hire an analyst to be part of its lending portfolio management platform based in Budapest.
DLG provides asset-backed financing solutions to institutional clients and manages a portfolio backed by a diverse range of assets including consumer loans, residential and commercial mortgages, corporate loans, etc. The asset management team within DLG provides ongoing portfolio management, monitoring and risk oversight, and reports to senior management.

About Morgan Stanley

Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. Throughout your contingent/leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley, you will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality. Our state-of-the-art offices in the City Centre have been designed to maximize collaboration.
At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modelling, Finance, Risk Management, Operations and Data & Analytics from our new state-of-the-art offices near the Danube and our City Gate office in the heart of the city center."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Who We Are

üåç Ready to join the ultimate decision-making dream team? Hop aboard the Rocketship!

At Finder, we're not just about helping people save money, make money, and snag sweet rewards; we're also on a mission to inject some excitement into the daily grind.

With offices in Sydney, Toronto, New York, London, and Wroclaw, we've built a dynamic community of over 290 curious minds. But we're not your typical corporate clan. Diverse thinkers united by our core purpose to make money easy, we have a shared passion for turning the norm on its head.

If you're itching to shake things up, develop your expertise, and be part of a crew that values creativity, drive, and a good dose of quirkiness, then you might just be the missing piece to our puzzle. So why wait? Join us and let's navigate this wild world of decisions together! üöÄüåü

Role Overview

The role‚Äôs purpose is to supercharge Finder‚Äôs data capabilities through the design, deployment and improvement of data analytics capabilities.

We are looking for a Data Analyst who will support our product teams with insights gained from analysing company data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimisation and to test the effectiveness of different courses of action.

They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-derived insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst at Finder, you will partner with stakeholders to build scalable infrastructure and a central hub of datasets and dashboards for the comparison business. This will support data-driven decisions and insights that translate directly to accelerate business growth and product improvement.

Work closely with the product, engineering, client services and publishing teams to support their decision making process with facts, insights and recommendations
Gather the requirements and determine the best course of action for analysis
Define a robust set of datasets and dashboards to support key business processes, e.g., forecasting, quarterly business planning etc.
Use the data to identify insights to inform hypotheses and test ideas.
Plan, and prioritise insights that drive Finder targets and ROI.
Analyse and evaluate A/B tests, report on results and recommend next steps
Build and maintain self-serve dashboards for internal and external stakeholders.
Train crew with dashboards / self serve analytics when needed.
Support company growth by discovering, analysing and communicating the critical user behavioural data

Desired Experience And Skills

Experience working with large-scale data sets
Experience of data analysis, cleaning or visualisation (for example using SQL, Python, spreadsheets or other technologies)
Experience in data modelling
Experience with Enterprise Digital Analytics such as Snowplow, GA360
Experience with modern data warehousing solutions (we use BigQuery)
Admirable team player qualities, including being collaborative, respectful, and service focused
A willingness to learn and apply various data analytics methodologies
A genuine passion for data and drive to communicate using data
Demonstrated analytical problem-solving skills and expertise
Demonstrated ability to pull apart complex data and communicate it to a non-technical audience

Preferred

Familiarity with dbt
Familiarity with GitHub
Deep understanding of building and maintaining data pipelines and assets, through robust change control.
Ability to work in an unstructured environment, navigate ambiguity, and bring clarity and structure as you go.
Ability to create and foster strong cross-functional networks and manage without authority.
Excellent presentation and communication skills.

Perks/Benefits

Vibrant office in the city center with a kitchen filled with snacks
Participation in our Finder Equity Plan (share options)
Organizational culture based on our core values
Multisport card
Access to training, development, and an extensive resource library
Private medical care
Lunch card
Hackofriday
Flexibility in when and where you can work with our hybrid policy, including opportunities to work abroad

Application Process

If this sounds like the kind of opportunity you've been looking for, select the 'Apply Now' button below to submit your cover letter and resume. Use your cover letter to introduce us to you; we want to know who you are, what you've worked on and why you think you'd be a great addition to the Finder team.

Inclusion

To build technology and products that are used and loved by people and solve real-world problems, we need to build a team with many different perspectives and experiences. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. 

We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible. Email talent@finder.com with any questions or feedback."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
Job Description:
"About the job
Data Analyst (CRM Specialisation)

As Data Analyst with CRM Specialisation, you will contribute to the success of the Sales & Marketing teams of Everfield's portfolio across Europe:
Use your experience in Sales & Marketing analytics to present actionable insights to our Sales & Marketing teams (HQ & Portfolio).
Work with implementation partners and portfolio companies to ensure CRM systems are implemented in alignment with Everfield standards.
Cooperate with Data Engineers to create sustainable data pipelines from various CRM systems.

The company:
Everfield is a platform with a mission in acquiring, building and operating vertical market and specialist software companies, focused on European businesses. We invest in and provide support and best practices to software companies in order for them to live up to their full potential by offering a very established approach to promote growth.

Everfield seeks to deliver innovation and growth to its acquired companies by providing best practices and operational support to help identify opportunities and install proven methodologies to accelerate customer and market share. Everfield is located throughout Europe, with offices in UK, Germany, the Netherlands, France, Poland, Spain, and Latvia.

The team:
You will join the Business Intelligence (BI) team as the fourth member. Currently the team consists of two Data Engineers and a hands-on team lead. The BI team creates value for various stakeholders (CEO, Finance, COO, Sales, Marketing, and Everfield‚Äôs portfolio companies), by creating insights, delivering analysis, automating reporting processes and improving data quality.

The team builds pipelines with Synapse to ingest the data into our data platform, uses Databricks for data transformation and Power BI for data visualization. For analytics the team also uses SQL.

The scope of the team is expected to scale with the company‚Äôs growth and maturity level. Everfield will scale from 16 portfolio companies currently, to approximately 90 companies in the next 4 years.

Responsibilities:
Requirements gathering
Align with key stakeholders to understand reporting requirements
Create feature development and communication plans
Data Analysis
Perform Sales & Marketing analysis such as Cohort, Funnel, Pipeline coverage analyses, Revenue forecasting, etc.
Data Visualization
Design proof of concept solutions to showcase new features with shortened feedback loop
Create and maintain Power BI reports used by hundreds of users
Data Ingestion, Verification and Validation
Extract raw data from upstream sources
Improving data quality and efficiency
Data modelling and Transformation
Build data systems and pipelines based on a medallion architecture
Structure sales processes
Go beyond the data and work together with Everfield‚Äôs Sales Lead to structure sales processes in the portfolio companies
Support portfolio companies in implementing Everfield‚Äôs suggested data structure on CRMs and ensure consistency of definitions across the portfolio

Ideal candidate profile:
The position requires a self-starting personality, that fits into an environment that is characterised by entrepreneurship and has a customer centric approach.
The candidate will have at least 3 years of experience within an international or complex environment and the right drive and ambition to make the difference.
Experienced with Sales analysis and business partnership with sales teams.
Relevant experience with Synapse or Azure Data Factory and Databricks is a plus-point.
Knowledge and hands on experience with Python (PySpark, Pandas).
Experienced with data modelling.
Experience with working in a DevOps team, following a structured, iterative Agile development process.
Fluent in English.
Above all, a great colleague, enthusiastic, approachable, honest, committed, result focused, a team player who wants to achieve the best results together.

What‚Äôs in it for you?
Grow your career in a fast-paced and growing organization.
Enable exponential growth by designing a world class data platform.
Working with the latest Data Analytics & Data Visualisation technologies.
Long term career opportunities.
Working closer to leadership teams within the Head Quarters and Portfolio.
Flexible work environment with offices around Europe (Netherlands, UK, Spain, France, Poland, Germany).

Continue the conversation
Interested? We would love to hear from you!

Apply now with your CV and if you are selected our Talent Acquisition colleague will contact you to schedule the 1st call and start our hiring process."

Title:
Junior Data & Insights Analyst
Junior Data & Insights Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Who We Are

We are Harbor Lab, a forward-thinking B2B software startup dedicated to fostering trust within the maritime ecosystem. Our vision is to revolutionize the way Shipping Companies and Port Agents conduct their operations, leveraging transparency and innovation to optimize the maritime industry's last mile. 

At Harbor Lab, we're committed to be the preferred partner for all maritime operations, driven by our core values of ambition, trustworthiness, genuine care for people, and agility. We bring value to both sides of the equation by streamlining processes, reducing costs, and facilitating well-informed decision-making. Our ultimate goal is to build trust in the maritime ecosystem and transform the way maritime businesses operate. 

Harbor Lab has also been recognized as one of the Best Workplaces in 2021 & 2022 & 2023 by the Great Place to Work Institute. 

About The Role

Data team is dedicated to provide innovative solutions and actionable insights that enable our company to stay ahead in a competitive market by harnessing the power of data to drive our business forward. As a member of the Data team, you will take on some of our biggest challenges and your work will impact the entire Harbor Lab experience. Our team moves very fast, so you'll have the opportunity to make an immediate difference! 

Are you fluent with Data? Do you pay attention to detail? Are you excited about joining a fast-pace, data-driven start-up environment? 

What You Will Be Doing

Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets from multiple sources to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights 
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to effectively communicate data findings to stakeholders 
Perform statistical analysis and predictive modeling to forecast future trends and business outcomes
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data requirements and provide analytical support. Work with the product team to help better understand the behaviour of our users, through usage and platform data, and find new ways to extract actionable intelligence from this data 
Present insights and recommendations to senior management to support strategic planning and decision-making
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and security in all analyses and reporting
Stay up-to-date with the latest data analytics tools, technologies, and best practices


Requirements

WE WOULD LOVE TO HEAR FROM YOU IF YOU HAVE

Educational background in Physics, Maths, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or other quantitative discipline or equivalent experience 
Up to 2 years of hands-on experience in data modelling, reporting and predictive analytics to tackle business and user problems 
Proficient in both SQL & Python 
Experience with data visualization tools such as Quicksight, Tableau or Power BI 
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail 
Ability to interpret complex data and communicate findings clearly to non-technical stakeholders 
Strong organizational and project management skills 
Experience to measurement methodologies such as A/B, Pre/Post or Causal impact 
Knowledge of data privacy regulations and best practices in data governance 


Additionally, The Following Will Be Considered a Plus

MSc / Ph.D. in relevant subjects 
Understanding of ETL pipelines and working with APIs 
Additional competence in data engineering, noSQL, Apache Hadoop, Spark 
Knowledge of ML techniques such as Decision Trees, Regression, Clustering, Bayesian networks & LLMs 


Benefits

WE OFFER

Attractive compensation package based on experience and skillset 
30 days of paid annual leave 
Private health insurance 
Flexible working hours 
Yoga classes & Life Coach Sessions 

If you feel you can contribute to our goals and want to join an ambitious, shipping tech company with a unique culture, we would love to hear from you.

Harbor Lab collects and processes personal data in accordance with the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). We are bound to use the information provided within your job application for recruitment purposes only and not to share these with any third parties. We will keep your resume in our database for any future consideration. In case you want to be deleted from our database, you can contact us at‚ÄØpeople@harborlab.com
 If you are applying to this job post, then we assume that you have the legal right to work in the EU"

Title:
Data-analist
Data-analist
Job Description:
"About the job
Data Analist bij Tremoot
Bij Tremoot zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Data Analist met uitgebreide ervaring in Power BI. Als je gepassioneerd bent over data visualisatie en graag werkt in een dynamische omgeving waar kwaliteit en privacy/security hoog in het vaandel staan, dan is deze rol perfect voor jou.

Waarom Tremoot?
Platte Organisatie: Geniet van directe en duidelijke communicatie.
Cultuur: Maak deel uit van een nieuwsgierig, betrokken en persoonlijk team. Voel je thuis!
Ontwikkeling: We benadrukken groei en ondersteunen voortdurende certificering en kennisdeling.
Plezier: Doe mee aan leuke teamuitjes en regelmatige bijeenkomsten die de teamgeest versterken!
Diversiteit en Inclusie: Ervaar een levendige mix van culturen met ons team van expats en externe medewerkers.
Gemeenschap: Bij Tremoot ben je meer dan alleen een medewerker - je bent een essentieel onderdeel van onze levendige gemeenschap.

Wat bieden wij?
Contract: Een vaste rol binnen een vooruitstrevend team.
Salaris: Competitief salaris dat past bij je ervaring en vaardigheden.
Reiskostenvergoeding: NS-businesskaart voor je reisbehoeften.
Vakantiedagen: 25 vakantiedagen om te ontspannen en op te laden.
Technologie: Je ontvangt een bedrijfslaptop voor professioneel gebruik.

Jouw Rol als Data Analist:
Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van datavisualisaties en rapportages met Power BI en Power BI Report Builder.
Samenwerken in Agile/Scrum teams om projecten te realiseren die voldoen aan de hoogste normen van kwaliteit en privacy/security.
Analyseren van data om inzichten te verschaffen die strategische besluitvorming ondersteunen.

Wat heb je nodig?
Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring.
Ervaring met data analyse en visualistie met PowerBI en PowerBI Report Builder.
Bekend met Agile en Scrum en kunt dit in de praktijk toepassen.
Nauwkeurig werkend, met oog voor kwaliteit en privacy/security aspecten.
Beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift.
HBO werk- en denkniveau.

Ge√Ønteresseerd?

Title:
Junior Data Analyst (EMEA, remote)
Junior Data Analyst (EMEA, remote)
Job Description:
"About the job
Margera is a boutique analytics agency founded by an x-Googler. We help Enterprise companies grow through the use of data and analytics. We are proud to support top companies in various industries such as banks (Eurobank, Piraeus Bank, Astrobank), travel-related (Aegean Airlines, Sani/ikos Hotels), tobacco (Philip Morris in 6 countries) and gaming (OPAP, Stoiximan, novibet). Our main services are Digital Analytics (we are the only Google Analytics Sales Partner in Greece/Cyprus), Data warehousing (on-prem or on the Cloud), BI and Machine Learning.
 We have an ambitious growth plan (x5 in 3 years) and we are looking for a professional who will be joining our Data Analytics Team.
 Here‚Äôs who we‚Äôre looking for:
 You are a fresh graduate that wants to start a great career. You must thrive on problem-solving when somebody assigns something challenging to you, you do not say ""this cannot be done"", but rather ""how can this be done?"". As a Data Analyst, you will be expected to gather information from various sources, interpret patterns and trends and conclude to actionable insights.
 Typical responsibilities for this role would be:
 The primary responsibility of the Data Analyst is to perform analysis that leads to actionable insights based on the needs of our Clients. 
  Analysis: Analyse data collected from various data sources, identify new data sources or ways to look at the data, perform the synthesis of insights to generate a coherent story
Reporting: Design and create reports for periodic or ad-hoc needs
Development: Assist in data definitions for data warehousing projects or digital analytics. Need to understand the semantics of the data and business to participating in data modeling workshops or tracking guides.

 We do not care about a prestigious university degree or social connections. We care about raw intellectual capacity and drive.
 You must have:
  University degree in Mathematics, Economics (or a similar field)
Native-level proficiency in Greek and at least fluency in English
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, text functions)
Data curiosity


 Bonus points for:
  Having completed relevant internships
Knowledge of data-related programming languages (Python, R, etc)
Strong knowledge of SQL
Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Qlickview)
Interest into Machine Learning/AI
At least 6 months of relevant work experience

 BENEFITS 
We know that the growth of our company is 100% based on our Team and therefore we are looking for talented and really ambitious people. If you are one of those rare breeds, you will be working with a team of young, smart people in a company with a clear growth mindset. 
 On top of this, we offer:
  Competitive salary
Monthly bonus
Discretionary annual salary increases
Internal trainings either product specific (like Google Analytics, Microsoft PowerBI) or data in general (SQL, AI/ML foundations).
Tech equipment (laptop and big screen)

 HIRING PROCESS
Our hiring process consists of the following steps: 
First Interview: An initial interview to get to know each other and discuss your qualifications and experience.
Exercise Assignment: An exercise, that will be send to you typically the same or the following day, which you need to complete and return to us within two days.
Virtual On-Site Day (Paid): On this day, we will give you an exercise to solve in the morning, which you will present to us at the end of the day. This day is designed for you to get to know the team, understand what a typical day is like with us, and experience working together (e.g., briefing, feedback, etc.). It also provides our team the opportunity to get to know you better and discuss the exercises you have prepared.
 If you want to be in a team that respects you, make an impact with your projects and learn new technologies and strategies through your work and trainings, then you should apply today. View more about Margera and learn how we make this happen."

Title:
Data analist
Data analist with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Ben jij een Data Analist met een passie voor econometrische vraagstukken en wil je een directe impact maken op bedrijfsresultaten? Als Data Analist bij Vermaat krijg je de kans om zelfstandig aan uitdagende projecten te werken. Jij gaat impact maken!

Jouw functie
Als Data Analist bij Vermaat ben je verantwoordelijk voor het ontwerpen, ontwikkelen en implementeren van voorspellingsmodellen, zoals het voorspellen van het aantal verwachte gasten. Deze modellen zijn essentieel voor het optimaliseren van onze workforce planning en inkoop van food & beverages, waardoor we verspilling minimaliseren en kosten optimaliseren.

Naast je analytische taken, speel je een sleutelrol in de verdere integratie van data analytics binnen de organisatie, waardoor Vermaat steeds meer data-gedreven wordt. Je bent een drijvende kracht in onze transitie naar data-gedreven bedrijfsvoering en helpt ons deze aanpak internationaal uit te rollen, met een focus op Frankrijk en Duitsland. Regelmatig contact en samenwerking met operationele teams in verschillende landen is een belangrijk onderdeel van je rol, inclusief af en toe reizen naar deze locaties.

Wat ga je doen?
Ontwerpen en ontwikkelen van voorspellingsmodellen voor het aantal verwachte gasten en deze implementeren in de operationele processen. In een gemiddelde werkweek zal je hier minimaal de helft van jouw tijd aan besteden.
Analyseren van data om waardevolle inzichten te verkrijgen en deze te vertalen naar concrete verbeteringen in de bedrijfsvoering.
Ondersteunen van de transitie naar een data-gedreven organisatie, inclusief de internationale uitrol in Frankrijk en Duitsland.
Samenwerken met verschillende afdelingen om data-analyse initiatieven te implementeren en te integreren.
Bewaken van de kwaliteit en integriteit van data en analyses.
Rapporteren en presenteren van bevindingen aan stakeholders

Jouw ingredi√´nten
Minimaal een afgeronde wetenschappelijke opleiding en 5 jaar relevante werkervaring.
Ervaring met Power BI en DAX, of vergelijkbare tooling. Kennis van Microsoft Azure Data Factory en ervaring met Fabric is een pr√©.
Ervaring met het cre√´ren van machine learning modellen in Python en het ontwikkelen van PySpark scripts (Forecasting model).
Affiniteit met econometrische vraagstukken en de drive om je hierin verder te ontwikkelen.
Nieuwsgierig en ondernemend, met sterke communicatieve vaardigheden die je in staat stellen complexe analyses begrijpelijk over te brengen.
Je kunt analyses en inzichten cre√´ren waar je collega's direct mee aan de slag kunnen, met een focus op gebruiksvriendelijkheid.
Ervaring met projectmanagement en de implementatie van analytische modellen in operationele processen.
Wij zoeken een resultaatgerichte professional die het leuk vindt om bij te dragen aan EBITDA-verbeteringen en zich thuis voelt in een omgeving waar bedrijfsresultaat centraal staat."

Title:

Job Description:
"About the job
What is Exoticca?
Exoticca is a pioneering online travel agency that has revolutionized the conception, production, and e-commerce of long-distance dream trips. At the core of Exoticca's brand equity is the commitment to ""creating life milestones."" We believe in delivering best-value trips, exploring unique destinations, curating extraordinary travel experiences, and demonstrating genuine care for both our customers and the planet.

We are a professional, dynamic, multicultural team in rapid international growth, seeking new partners to help us create the best and most forward-thinking travel company of our generation.

What is our proposal?
Join our Data Insights Team, where you'll play a key role in leveraging data for decision-making across Exoticca. As our Data Analyst, your main responsibilities include:
Utilize SQL to extract and analyze data.

Extremely detail oriented and proactive.
Ability to present complex things in an easily understandable way.

Benefits:
Competitive compensation package in line with job responsibilities and experience.

Hybrid work model. Offices in Barcelona.
Permanent contract from the start.
Travel packages at reduced prices!
Referral bonus, if you bring people as talented as you.
Unlimited coffee, team lunches, English lesson, bi-anual company parties.
And last but not least, becoming part of a fun and motivated multicultural team at an agile and rapidly growing organization!.

Join Exoticca and play a pivotal role in creating life milestones through unforgettable travel experiences! This is your opportunity to shape the future of a dynamic and innovative travel brand on a global scale.

Exoticca is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusiveness are our core. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under European, country, or local law.

Title:
Marketing Data Analyst (all genders)
Marketing Data Analyst (all genders) with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
The role in a Snapshot 

Are you passionate about disrupting the future of education and to make a real impact? Do you want a career in an edtech company that is innovative and rewarding? Join us and enjoy working alongside an international team of talented thinkers, doers and magic makers.

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Marketing Data Analyst to join our central Data Team. You will play a key role in developing and maintaining our BI infrastructure, overseeing data governance as well as driving actionable insights and making direct impact on efficiency of marketing expenditures.

Location

Remote within Austria, Germany, and Spain. Hybrid is also possible in Vienna, Berlin, and Madrid.

Your Role in Our Journey 

Partner closely with Marketing leaders and stakeholders to shape the marketing strategy through data-driven insights and impactful analysis. 
Provide and present reports that are actionable for business departments and support the decision making process. 
Work closely with Data Analysts and Data Engineers, support and mentor colleagues within Data & business teams to build, maintain and improve the set of current dashboards applying best Business Intelligence practices. 
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, refine, organize and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with business objectives. 
Design and develop Data Models that empowers end users to answer their own questions. 
Drive adaptation of new tools & technologies in BI area to maintain a clean, accurate, and efficient data governance framework. 

Your impact 

3+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst / Data Analyst or related role. 
Strong Marketing analytics background, with proven experience in digital marketing projects. Experience in attribution modeling is a plus. 
Proven proficiency in SQL, with strong experience in building clean and meaningful tables. 
Expert-level knowledge of Tableau with outstanding data storytelling skills. 
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data governance principles, and ETL processes. Experience with DBT and Amazon Web Services or other cloud computer platforms is a plus. 
Strong problem solving, analytical thinking and organizational qualities. 
Strong communication skills, and ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels. 

Your way to unlock your full potential

Disrupting Education: Join us for a unique opportunity to disrupt the traditional education landscape. It's not just a job; it's a chance to be part of something big and meaningful. 
Global Dream Team: Say hello to an international and diverse crew of thinkers, doers, and magic makers. Get ready to be inspired daily by your colleagues from around the world. 
Work, Your Way: We offer a flexible, hybrid work environment that respects your need for work-life harmony with 2/3 remote days a week & 5 fully remote weeks a year so you can shine in a way that suits you best. 
Office Shenanigans: Our regular team and office events will keep your spirits high. We believe in bonding, celebrating, and having a blast together. 
Strength in Unity: Join one of our GoStudent Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and be part of communities that champion causes you're passionate about. 
Growing is LIT: The sky's the limit in our EdTech playground. Access a wide array of online and in-person learning and development opportunities to build your career as high as your dreams can take you. 
Support Around the Clock: We've got your back 24/7. Enjoy a comprehensive Employee Support Programme that's not just for you but for your loved ones too. 

Life at GoStudent:

Do you want to reimagine education together with us and join a mission to believe in?

GoStudent is one of the world‚Äôs leading tutoring providers and education platforms. We‚Äôre also a unicorn and have raised more than ‚Ç¨675m investment to date. Together with our acquisitions Seneca Learning, Tus Media and Studienkreis, we currently support more than 11 million families each month to fulfil our vision to help each student reach their full potential.

We are passionate about disrupting the future of education and making a real impact. Join our journey and unlock your creativity and advance your career by mastering exciting challenges together with an international, driven team. We are here to support your goals and to discover how far we can reach by growing smarter and stronger together. If this sounds good to you, then join us now and unlock your full potential.

Openness Statement

At GoStudent, we are an open and welcoming bunch that values your unique skills, passion, and potential. We don't hire based on age, gender, nationality, or political views, but rather focus on your talent and motivation to contribute to the future of learning. Even if you are a unicorn - just as GoStudent is: if you believe that you can make a positive impact, we encourage you to throw your hat in the ring & to apply, regardless of whether you meet every requirement. Our team is diverse, and we believe that this diversity fosters creativity and innovation, making us a better company. Join us in reimagining the future of learning!

Learn more about ""Who we are""

Please upload your CV/Resume in PDF format, preferably in English, as a DOC format might not be supported.

Disclose Privacy & Compliance Information"

Chi siamo:

In Peroptyx siamo alla ricerca di analisti di dati che esaminino i dati cartografici per le applicazioni di mappatura digitale. Le vostre capacit√† di ricerca convalideranno e garantiranno che la navigazione di determinati percorsi sia accurata e sicura.

Nell'ambito di questo ruolo, verificherete che i nomi delle aziende e gli orari di apertura siano corretti. Verificherete che la distanza da un punto di partenza a una destinazione finale sia indicata con precisione, migliorando cos√¨ l'esperienza degli utenti.

Con questo lavoro potrete pianificare le vostre giornate in base a un orario di lavoro altamente flessibile, lavorare nei fine settimana o in tarda serata, il tutto comodamente dal vostro ufficio.
La flessibilit√† dei nostri ruoli riduce al minimo l'impatto sulla vostra routine quotidiana.

Candidato ideale

Conoscenza fluente dell'inglese e dell'italiano.
Ottime capacit√† di ricerca.
Ottima conoscenza locale del proprio Paese.
Buona comprensione e conoscenza generale della geografia e della cultura italiana.
Mentalit√† analitica.

Requisiti lavorativi

Deve risiedere in Italia da un minimo di 5 anni consecutivi.
Deve superare un esame online a libro aperto che possa verificare la piena comprensione del materiale e dei concetti.
Deve essere disposto a lavorare un minimo di 10 ore e fino a 20 ore a settimana a seconda della disponibilit√† delle mansioni.
Buona conoscenza operativa dei motori di ricerca, delle applicazioni cartografiche e familiarit√† con le piattaforme dei social media.
Forte capacit√† di apprendere, comprendere e applicare pi√π serie di istruzioni diverse.
Tutto il lavoro deve essere di natura indipendente.

Benefici

Lavorare fino a 20 ore alla settimana.
Guadagno competitivo.
Sviluppare le proprie capacit√† di ricerca.
Evitare i lunghi spostamenti.
Lavorare comodamente da casa.
Godetevi la flessibilit√† di stabilire il vostro orario di lavoro!"

Title:
Data Analyst ‚Äì Process Associate ‚Äì English ‚Äì Hybrid Budapest
Data Analyst ‚Äì Process Associate ‚Äì English ‚Äì Hybrid Budapest with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
With a startup spirit and 115,000 + curious and courageous minds, we have the expertise to go deep with the world‚Äôs biggest brands‚Äîand we have fun doing it! We dream in digital, dare in reality, and reinvent the ways companies work to make an impact far bigger than just our bottom line. We‚Äôre harnessing the power of technology and humanity to create meaningful transformation that moves us forward in our pursuit of a world that works better for people. 
 Now, we‚Äôre calling upon the thinkers and doers, those with a natural curiosity and a hunger to keep learning, keep growing. People who thrive on fearlessly experimenting, seizing opportunities, and pushing boundaries to turn our vision into reality. And as you help us create a better world, we will help you build your own intellectual firepower. 
 Welcome to the relentless pursuit of better.

Inviting applications for the role of Data Analyst ‚Äì Process Associate ‚Äì English ‚Äì Hybrid Budapest!

Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Generate Reports for Daily operations & KPI Management using SQL, Excel Power Query, VBA and MS Access
‚Ä¢ Maintain reports, Dashboard & spreadsheets for historical data, manage email queues 
‚Ä¢ Work closely with Operations for daily, weekly & monthly reports 
‚Ä¢ Generate insights on existing data to internal/external stakeholders 
‚Ä¢ Automate report generation using VBA
‚Ä¢ Analyze multiple data sources to create customized and provide business insights 
‚Ä¢ Create mail alerts / notifications for metrics
‚Ä¢ Manage issues with reports through timely resolutions and support data requests

Qualifications we seek in you
Minimum Qualifications/ Skills
‚Ä¢ Good communication skills both written and verbal 
‚Ä¢ Should be very comfortable with handling lots of data & numbers 
‚Ä¢ Should have a good working knowledge of using Advanced Excel, Power Query, MS Access Database, VBA and SQL
‚Ä¢ Ability to manage and coordinate multiple assignments simultaneously in a deadline-driven, fast-paced environment required 
‚Ä¢ Good analytical and quantitative skills and the ability to see trends and patterns in data and translate data into decisions
Preferred Qualifications/ Skills
‚Ä¢ Good Knowledge Microsoft ADO Library in VB / VBA
‚Ä¢ Tableau
‚Ä¢ Power BI
‚Ä¢ Presentation Skills
‚Ä¢ Basic Sourcing / Material Management / Planning / Supply Chain Knowledge

What can we offer?
‚Ä¢ Multicultural and very diverse environment with people from over 30 countries
‚Ä¢ Genpact supports language courses, professional trainings, personal development
‚Ä¢ Friendly working environment, including gym, cafeteria, hairdresser and a medical center, all conveniently located on the office campus
‚Ä¢ Great career-development opportunities
‚Ä¢ Opportunities to leverage your accounting and finance skills
‚Ä¢ Opportunity for process improvement/simplification/standardization
‚Ä¢ Flexible working hours/home office

Genpact is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Genpact is committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation. For more information, visit www.genpact.com . Follow us on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and YouTube.
Furthermore, please do note that Genpact does not charge fees to process job applications and applicants are not required to pay to participate in our hiring process in any other way. Examples of such scams include purchasing a 'starter kit,' paying to apply, or purchasing equipment or training."

Title:
Data analyst
Data analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this mission, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilities
Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.

What we look for
Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.

What we offer
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Our pay packages are designed to attract and retain top professionals. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ‚Ç¨52,246. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Commitment & contract
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.

Location
Milan (Italy) or fully remote.

Before you apply
Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We‚Äôre extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply.

The selection process
We welcome applications in English and Italian. If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply."
